page.title: 13Letham Glen.
page.content: Letham Glen has been a public park since 1925 and was named after a local farmer.An open-air swimming pool was replaced by a sunken garden and the site of a coal pit was levelled off to form the car park. The Nature Centre,built from timber from the glen itself,displays information and pictures of many types of wildlife .Animals from the glen may be brought inside, allowing children to gain a better under- standing of the animals in their studies.School projects are welcome and can be displayed in the centre. The pets corner has numerous varieties of fowl, rabbits, deer and donkeys. There are also goats in residence which have proved to be a great attraction.
